Setting Topic Options

In your personal options, you can specify the criteria that the application uses to determine whether a topic or response has been read. You can also indicate how often the application should search for new topics and responses and how topic locking issues should be handled.

To set topic options:

  1. Select Tools > Personal Options from the menu bar. The Personal Options dialog opens.

  2. Select the Topic tab.

  3. Select any of the following Mark as Read options:

    • Select the When topic is selected to mark a topic as read as soon as you select it.

    • Select the When selected for __ seconds or more button and enter a number to mark a topic as read after it has been selected for a certain number of seconds. The range is from 15 to 9999 seconds.

    • Select the Only when manually marked as read button to mark a topic as read only when you select the Topic > Mark as Read menu option. This option is the default.

      • Note: Topics are always marked as read when you display their properties.

  4. From System tray notifications, select the Check for new or modified topics every __ minutes check box to have the application inform you at regular intervals that topics for which you are a recipient have changed. If this option is selected, you must also specify the number of minutes between checks. (The default is 10 minutes). Clear the box if you do not wish the application to place an icon in the system tray to let you know about these topics.

  5. In Locking Options:

    • Select the Exclusively lock topic on edit check box to lock a topic when you open its properties dialog to edit it. Clear this check box if you do not wish to lock such topics.

    • Select the Clear topic locks after edit check box to unlock a locked topic after you have edited its properties, and clicked OK to create a new revision. Clear this check box if you do not wish to remove the locks.

  6. Select from the URL options:

    • To use a special template to generate display text for URLs of this type, enter its name in the Display Template field. For more information on templates, see the StarTeam User's Guide.

    • Select or clear Generate ID-based URLs. When this option is selected, the URL will be specified by ID rather than by name. For example, an ID-based URL would be starteam://hostname:49201/12;ns=Project;scheme=id, while a name-based URL would be starteam://hostname:49201/myproject.

  7. Click OK to save your preferences, and close the Personal Options dialog.

Note: If you do not select either of the Locking Options, opening a topic will not lock it; you must manually lock and unlock it. If you select the Exclusively lock option only, topics that are not already locked become locked when you open them and unlocked when you click Cancel or OK. If you select the Clear topic locks option only, any topic that you have locked manually becomes unlocked when you click OK to create a new revision. If you select both options, you can lock topics manually or by opening them. These topics become unlocked when you click OK to create new revisions or (if they were not locked prior to being opened) when you click Cancel.
